basics.name: Soojung Yi
basics.label: Postdoctoral Fellow, Research Institute for Basic Sciences, Seoul National University
basics.summary: Biophysical chemist specialized in quantitative analysis of gene expression dynamics and protein–protein interactions inside living bacterial cells. Experienced in single-molecule and live-cell imaging, microfluidics-based single-cell tracking, microbial physiology, and protein biochemistry. Develops new imaging-based methodologies (e.g., KD-FRET) to probe intracellular molecular interactions with high spatiotemporal precision.

researchSummary: Biophysicist focusing on quantitative analysis of gene expression and protein interactions in living bacterial cells, integrating live-cell imaging, single-cell analysis, microbial physiology, and protein biochemistry.

work.name: Research Institute for Basic Sciences, Seoul National University
work.summary: Developing quantitative imaging and microbiology approaches to study protein–protein interactions and bacterial physiology.

work.name: Single-molecule & Cell Biology Lab, Department of Chemistry, Seoul National University
work.summary: PhD work combining single-molecule biophysics, bacterial genetics, and quantitative imaging to study protein interactions and gene expression in living cells.
highlights: Developed KD-FRET for in-cell quantification of protein–protein interaction strength (Advanced Science, Editor’s Choice).
Investigated transcription–translation dynamics and growth physiology in Vibrio natriegens using custom single-cell microfluidics devices.
Performed long-term live-cell imaging of intracellular protein dynamics with high temporal resolution.
Conducted NMR-based structural characterization of VAMP2–α-synuclein interactions.
Integrated biochemical, structural, and single-cell imaging approaches to study molecular interactions across scales.

work.name: Laboratory of Structural Biology, School of Biological Sciences, Seoul National University
highlights: Determined PHF7 structure by X-ray crystallography using proteins purified from Sf9 insect cells.

work.name: Systems Neuroscience Lab, Department of Chemistry, Seoul National University
highlights: Gained hands-on experience in mouse handling, perfusion, genotyping, stereotaxic surgery, immunohistochemistry, and behavioral tests.
Trained in CLARITY, expansion microscopy, and two-photon microscopy.

work.name: Laboratory of Apoptosis & Molecular Disease, School of Biological Sciences, Seoul National University
highlights: Performed cell-based library screening to identify modulators of α-synuclein and tau internalization and propagation.

work.name: Laboratory of Proteolytic Systems, Department of Chemistry, Seoul National University
highlights: Performed gene cloning, protein purification, and enzymatic assays to investigate the functional relationship between heat shock protease DegP and acid shock protein Asr.

work.name: Department of Chemistry, Imperial College London
highlights: Cloned plasmids expressing Plasmodium falciparum PfPLP1A/B, regulators of malaria-related chaperonin CCT.
